document.docAuthor: Shah, Bismillah, Naveed, Hassan & Duan, Yani
document.masterDocTitle: A new species and four new records of Stirellus Osborn & Ball (Hemiptera Cicadellidae: Deltocephalinae: Stenometopiini) from Pakistan with a revised key to species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species and four new records of Stirellus Osborn & Ball (Hemiptera Cicadellidae: Deltocephalinae: Stenometopiini) from Pakistan with a revised key to species

mods:name.mods:affiliation: School of Plant Protection, Anhui Agricultural University, Hefei, Anhui Province 230036, China. bismillahshah 1990 @ yahoo. com; https: // orcid. org / 0000 - 0002 - 8407 - 8627

School of Plant Protection, Anhui Agricultural University, Hefei, Anhui Province 230036, China. bismillahshah 1990 @ yahoo. com; https: // orcid. org / 0000 - 0002 - 8407 - 8627

heading.emphasis:
Key to species of
Stirellus Osborn & Ball
from Pakistan

paragraph.keyLead:
1. Crown more than twice as long as width between eyes ( Fig. 1A, 1C )...............................
S . capitatus
n. rec.
- Crown less than twice as long as width between eyes ( Figs 2A , 3A , 4A , 5A )...................................... 2
2. Crown and/or pronotum, mesonotum and scutellum with orange-red to brownish red markings ( Fig. 5 A–B)............. 3
- Crown and/or pronotum, mesonotum and scutellum without orange-red to brownish red markings ( Figs 2A , 3A , 4A )....... 5

3. Crown and pronotum, mesonotum and scutellum with longitudinal orange-red bands (See
Shah et al ., 2020: 192
, Fig. 1 A–B)........................................................................................
S . kumratensis
- Crown with transverse band, with or without surplus spots, orange-red to brownish-red ( Fig. 5 A–B)................... 4

4. Crown anterior margin rounded ( Fig. 5 A–E)...............................................
S . rubrolineatus
n. rec.

- Crown anterior margin acutely angled (See
Shah et al ., 2020: 194
, Fig. 3 A–C)..........................
S . neoconvexus

5. Aedeagus small, with apex not curved dorsad (See
Shah et al ., 2020: 195
, Fig. 4H ).......................
S . thattaensis
- Subgenital plate with macrosetae uniseriate laterally ( Figs 2F , 4F )............................................... 8

7. Crown with anterior margin slightly bulbous (See
Shah et al ., 2020: 200
, Fig. 9A); subgenital plate somewhat concave at near midlength (See
Shah et al ., 2020: 201
, Fig. 10B); connective stem longer than anterior arms (See
Shah et al ., 2020: 201
, Fig. 10C)......................................................................................
S . mankiensis

- Crown with anterior margin not bulbous ( Fig. 3A, 3C ); subgenital plate not concave at near midlength ( Fig. 3F ); connective stem equal in length to anterior arms ( Fig. 3F )..............................................
S . pakhtunensis
sp. n.

8. Crown with subapical spots ( Fig. 2A, 2C ); pygofer lobe with few macrosetae ( Fig. 2E )..................
S . indrus
n. rec.

10. Crown 1.5x longer than breadth between eyes (See
Shah et al ., 2020: 193
, Fig. 2A ). Pygofer lobe with caudal region curved (See
Shah et al ., 2020: 193
, Fig. 2E ).............................................................
S . lahorensis

- Crown less than 1.5x longer than breadth between eyes (See
Shah et al ., 2020: 196
, Fig. 5A ). Pygofer lobe with caudal region smooth (See
Shah et al ., 2020: 196
, Fig. 5C )........................................................
S . viridulus

11. Crown evenly rounded anteriorly ( Fig. 4A, 4C )................................................
S . rotundus
n. rec.

- Crown angularly rounded anteriorly (See
Shah et al ., 2020: 192
, Figs 6A, 6C, 8A, 8D)..........................
S . tolla
